page.title: 14TERLING HOUSING AND HOMELIFE
page.content: Nearly all the houses in the village belong to Lord Rayleigh, although some are privately owned or council houses. People find it hard to come in and buy houses in the village and building is discouraged. Most of the houses in the centre of the village are of lathe and plaster and timber framed, and many are over 300 years old. One or two were built in the 13th or 14th Century e.g. Vine Cottage, Church Cottage and Ringers Farm, which is being renovated this year for a TV celebrity from "Crossroads". A huge curved beam has been found here, which may have come from the Bishop's Palace. There is a fine Tudor House opposite the Church, also a windmill, which is now a house. Rayleigh houses are maintained by the estate yard, which employs several men. Many of the villagers work on the estate farms, as have their ancestors.
